questions.question_text: A network technician installs a web server on the firewall. Which of the following methods should the technician implement to allow access to outside users without giving access to the inside network?

discussion.content: Never knew a web server can be installed on a firewall. But, I figured the answer was DMZ.
Hope this server is light weight, else it will crush the firewall....stupid network engineer!

comments.content: VLAN is definitely not the better option. DMZ will seperate the server from the network completely as an isolated point. VLAN means hosting the server inside the network on a different LAN. Bad idea.

discussion.content: VLan seems like a better option

questions.question_text: A Chief Information Officer (CIO) tasks the network engineer with protecting the network from outside attacks. Placing which of the following devices on the network perimeter would provide the MOST security for the system?

comments.content: While a traditional firewall (A) is designed to filter traffic based on IP addresses and ports, an NGFW (Next-Generation Firewall) combines traditional firewall functionality with additional features such as deep packet inspection, intrusion detection and prevention (IDS/IPS), application-layer filtering, and more. NGFWs offer a higher level of security by examining the content of network packets at a deeper level and providing more advanced threat detection and prevention capabilities.

discussion.content: What's a firewall but better, oh why we have the Next Gen FireWall!

Next-generation firewall
A next-generation firewall is a part of the third generation of firewall technology, combining a traditional firewall with other network device filtering functions, such as an application firewall using in-line deep packet inspection, an intrusion prevention system. Wikipedia

As more networks go wireless, you need to pay special attention to issues
associated with them. Wireless survey tools can be used to create heat maps
showing the quantity and quality of wireless network coverage in areas. They
can also allow you to see access points (including rogues) and security settings.
These can be used to help you design and deploy an efficient network, and they
can also be used (by you or others) to find weaknesses in your existing network
(often marketed for this purpose as wireless analyzers).

questions.question_text: Management has requested that a wireless solution be installed at a new office. Which of the following is the FIRST thing the network technician should do?

discussion.content:
per Jason Dion...
OBJ-2.5: A T1 can transmit 24 telephone calls at a time because it uses a digital carrier signal (DS-1). DS-1 is a communications protocol for multiplexing the bit streams of up to 24 telephone calls simultaneously. The T1's maximum data transmission rate is 1.544 Mbps. DOCSIS is the standard for a cable modem. DSL is a Digital Subscriber Line which has variable speeds from 256 Kbps and up. POTS is the Plain Old Telephone System, and provides only a single phone connection at a time. Out of these options, the T1 is the BEST to ensure you can reliably provide 23 simultaneous phone connections.

Selected Answer: C
Let us go with T1, so far, the best transmission

I suggest reading the question a number of times. The question uses the term ... "MOST", meaning the closest we can get to 23 concurrent channels is through T1. This is my take on this question. I stand to be corrected

How T1 could be the answer? A T1 circuit has limitation of 1.5Mbps. 23 concurrent VOIP channels need minimum of 23 x 100Kbps bandwidth which is 2.3Mbps > 1.5! DSL has different upload and download bandwidth and recent DOCSIS Cable Modems are capable of higher upload/download bandwidth. So IMO, a DOCSIS would be a better choice in terms of bandwidth requirement.
This is a professor messer question on study group its C

comments.content: D is for cable modems. T1 is the answer C

discussion.content: Yea I figured this was the answer but... yall go it wrong . A T1 has 24 channels not 23. Just saying

questions.question_text: Which of the following WAN technologies is MOST preferred when developing a VoIP system with 23 concurrent channels?

A technician has deployed an additional DHCP server for redundancy. Clients in certain subnets are not receiving DHCP leases from the new DHCP server.
Which of the following is the MOST likely cause?

discussion.content:
The ARP works best with Switches, and not DHCP.
There should be an IP helper/relay agent initiated for the 2 DHCP to see each other.

ANSWER A is incorrect the correct answer is C reason A technician has deployed an additional DHCP server for redundancy. Clients in certain subnets are not receiving DHCP leases from the new DHCP server. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause? ... The ARP cache of the new DHCP server needs to be updated.

choices.C: The ARP cache of the new DHCP server needs to be updated.
choices.D: The ARP table on the router needs to be cleared.
choices.B: The new DHCP server is not receiving the requests from the clients.
choices.A: The new DHCP server's IP address was not added to the router's IP helper list.
